faqRef.question: What is the difference between under eye filler and under eye botox?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Botox works to inhibit your muscles from contracting, resulting in a more relaxed look and a smoother, youthful appearance. Under Eye filler is injected to replenish volume loss and has nothing to do with muscle movement. Some patients may benefit from both treatments, other patients may just need one. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

@graph.name: Under Eye Filler
@graph.description: Non-surgical treatment using hyaluronic acid-based dermal filler to restore volume and reduce the appearance of dark circles and hollows under the eyes.
@graph.howPerformed: Hyaluronic acid–based dermal filler is injected into the under-eye area to restore volume, smooth the skin, and reduce the appearance of dark circles and hollows.
@graph.preparation: Avoid alcohol consumption for 3 days prior to receiving under-eye filler. Consult with your medical provider about discontinuing blood-thinning medications such as Ibuprofen, Excedrin, Aspirin, Aleve, and Fish Oil. Do not wear makeup to your appointment.
@graph.followup: Results are visible immediately and settle over 2–4 weeks; mild swelling or tenderness is common and typically resolves naturally.

@graph.name: Temple Filler

ourApproach.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"At Lushful Aesthetics we address nasolabial folds utilizing filler with ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17763611/#:~:text=The%20purpose%20of%20the%20Fern,deepen%20with%20expressive%20facial%20movements."},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"value":"the fern technique","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". This technique is designed to inject filler very superficially into the dermis to strengthen the tissue and prevent filler migration. Research has shown that filler injected too deep in this region leads to more migration due to the degree of dynamic movement in the perioral region. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

faqRef.question: How long does nasolabial and perioral filler last?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The perioral area and nasolabial folds are areas of intense dynamic movement. But we always assess patients prior to refilling, as we never want to overfill.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

beforeAfterServiceDescription: View our lip filler before and after video to see the subtle yet impactful enhancements lip fillers can bring. At Lushful Aesthetics, we specialize in delivering natural lip filler results, understanding that the goal is not just about volume, but about refining the lips' contour to complement your overall facial symmetry. With results lasting from six months to a year, our lip enhancement before and after video demonstrates how treatments lead to more hydrated, well-defined lips.

faqRef.question: How long does lip filler last?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The lips are an area of dynamic movement. Therefore, upper lip filler and lower lip filler tend to not last as long as other areas such as the cheeks, chin, and jawline. The more filler injected, the longer the filler lasts. With the first syringe, med spa patients should expect to require more filler within 6-8 months. After the second syringe, the filler will last over a year. Because we never want to overfill this area, we go based on assessment and not a strict timeline in regards to when filler needs to be touched up.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Can lip filler be dissolved?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Yes. Because we only utilize hyaluronic acid based fillers in the lips, they can be completely dissolved.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: How long does it take for lip filler to settle?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Typically, lip fillers take at least 2 weeks to settle. However, some patients may have residual swelling and should expect to wait at least 4 weeks to appreciate the final result.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

metaTitle: Best Natural Looking Lip Filler NYC | Lushful Aesthetics

@graph.name: Lip Filler
@graph.description: Lip filler injections are designed to define and hydrate the lips, providing immediate results that typically last between six months to a year.
@graph.howPerformed: Hyaluronic acid-based dermal filler is injected into the lips to enhance volume, shape, and definition, ensuring a natural and balanced appearance.
@graph.preparation: Avoid alcohol consumption for 3 days prior to receiving lip filler injections. Consult with your medical provider about discontinuing blood-thinning medications such as Ibuprofen, Excedrin, Aspirin, Aleve, and Fish Oil. Do not wear makeup to your appointment.
@graph.followup: Results are visible immediately and settle over 2–4 weeks; mild swelling or tenderness is common and typically resolves naturally.

ourApproach.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jawline filler is one of Lushful Aesthetics' most popular procedures and is one of the more common aesthetic clinic services, focusing on creating more of a chiseled jawline. This is done with a nonsurgical jawline contouring procedure utilizing Radiesse®, which lasts 3 years. Radiesse filler is the superior option for jawlines since it is a firmer product that has a bio-stimulator effect, which creates long-lasting collagen and elastin. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\nMen typically require between 5-7 syringes to create a defined jawline. Women may only require 3-4 syringes. Aesthetic clinic patients need to understand that the jawline is a large area, and achieving a truly chiseled result requires a substantial amount of jawline filler. Smaller amounts can be used, but patients are advised that they will likely only see a minimal improvement in jawline structure. Our jawline filler procedure often includes the chin to maintain facial harmonization. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

faqRef.question: Who should not get jawline fillers?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Jaw filler is not recommended for patients who have prominent jowls or excessive loose skin along the jawline and neck. While Radiesse can give you a sharper jawline, it cannot tighten excessively loose skin. Patients with significant submental fullness (double chin or excessive neck fat) are also not ideal candidates for jaw filler as they may not fully appreciate the result.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: What's the difference in approaches to jawline fillers for men vs. women?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"A masculine jawline is sharper and more chiseled, with an angle closer to 90 degrees. While women certainly can still have defined jawlines, they tend to be less chiseled and usually have a wider angle that does not make their faces look square. Because men require more definition and tend to have larger faces,  more jaw filler is needed to provide optimal results.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

metaDescription: Lushful Aesthetics of NYC cheek filler creates modelesque cheeks to provide contours that define and highlight every aspect of the face with minimal invasiveness.
metaTitle: Best Cheek Filler For Contouring in NYC | Lushful Aesthetics

@graph.name: Cheek Filler
@graph.description: Minimally invasive cheek filler procedure using strategically placed cannula injections to enhance cheek structure, volume, and profile definition in both medial and lateral midface.
@graph.howPerformed: A single entry point using a cannula on the side of each cheek is used to inject dermal filler into the medial and lateral cheek zones to enhance structure while minimizing bruising and vascular complications.
@graph.preparation: Avoid alcohol for three days prior to treatment; consult your provider about discontinuing blood-thinning medications (e.g. Ibuprofen, Excedrin, Aspirin, Aleve, Fish Oil); do not wear makeup to your appointment.
@graph.followup: Results are visible immediately and settle over 2–4 weeks; expect minimal swelling or tenderness post-treatment that resolves naturally.

The second method of NeckTox addresses the platysmal bands that are often associated with thinner aging patients. ourApproach.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Our Botox neck lift procedure involves micro-dosing Botox across the neck's surface.  This treatment aims to reduce turkey neck, smooth fine lines, and curb excessive sweating. For Platysmal bands Botox, toxin is injected directly into the bands to relax them so they no longer protrude when the patient animates their face and strains their neck. This can often give the patient’s lower face a more “lifted” appearance, as the platysma bands tend to pull the face down as we age. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

It can be done in one or two different ways. It can treat horizontal neck lines to soften them and/or treat the strong platysmal bands that often become more visible as we age. faqRef.question: Who is a candidate for neck Botox?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The ideal candidate for neck Botox at our top medical spa clinic for men is someone who is concerned about visible vertical bands or horizontal lines on their neck.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: What are the side effects of neck Botox?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Patients from our med spa rarely have side effects from NeckTox, but when they do, they are minimal. The most common are bruising, swelling, and redness. Swelling subsides within 30 minutes of the procedure, while redness and bruising can vary from patient to patient. Redness will go away within 24 hours, while bruises may take a few days or more to fade.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Will Botox remove my horizontal neck lines?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Though Botox to tighten neck skin improves horizontal lines, it will not completely remove the line. This aesthetic clinic treatment is best combined with filler and laser resurfacing treatments in order to treat the concern with a multimodality treatment plan. This will yield the most optimal results.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: How long does neck Botox last?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Botox in the platysmal bands lasts 3-4 months like Botox in other areas of muscle. Superficial Botox for neck lines in the skin typically is much more subtle but does last 3-4 months as well.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: I've had Botox for my face. Can I combine that with a NeckTox treatment?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Yes! Patients will often have their NeckTox procedure done at the same time as their facial botox. It’s always easiest to get everything done together to be sure the face and neck are balanced. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

metaTitle: Experience a Botox neck lift with NeckTox. Smooth neck wrinkles, treat prominent platysmal bands, achieve a rejuvenated neck profile at our aesthetic clinic.

@graph.name: NeckTox (Neck Botox Injections)
@graph.description: Professional neuromodulator injections to soften horizontal neck lines and relax prominent platysmal bands associated with “tech neck” and age-related neck changes.
@graph.howPerformed: Small doses of neuromodulator are injected superficially along horizontal lines and/or into targeted platysmal bands by a licensed provider using sterile technique in an outpatient setting.
@graph.preparation: Avoid alcohol for three days before treatment and discontinue blood-thinning medications (e.g., Ibuprofen, Excedrin, Aspirin, Aleve, Fish Oil) approximately one week prior, as directed by your provider.
@graph.followup: A follow-up visit is typically scheduled about 1–2 weeks after treatment for assessment and any needed adjustments; avoid strenuous activity and rubbing the treated area for 24–48 hours.

beforeAfterServiceDescription: View our transformative Botox results at Lushful Aesthetics, our expert treatments ensure a natural, refreshed appearance without the undesired frozen look. Our before and after Botox video showcases the significant yet subtle rejuvenation of the treatment. Whether it's your first visit or a follow-up for touch-ups, our personalized assessment ensures you receive the precise units needed for your desired outcome. At Lushful Aesthetics, we prioritize a look that enhances your natural features. We offer an individualized approach to prevent and treat fine lines and wrinkles, ensuring your satisfaction every time you look in the mirror.

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Botox usually lasts 3-4 months on average.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Will my face be frozen?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Being frozen is not the goal for most patients. You will not be frozen unless you request to have very restricted movement. Typically, patients' goals are to have limited movement for a naturally refreshed appearance, which should occur within a few days after the injections.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Why do I need to come back in 2 weeks after my appointment?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Coming back for your 2-week appointment is crucial to see if you need any touch-ups. Sometimes patients need an extra unit here or there. Because it’s usually just a sprinkle if a touch-up is even necessary, there is no additional cost. We make a note in your chart so we know how much to adjust for your next treatment.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: How do I know how many units I need?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The number of neurotoxin units you’ll need will be determined during our in-office assessment. The ultimate thing to keep in mind is that stronger facial muscles require more neurotoxin for movement restriction. We’ll of course also keep in mind your goals and how much movement you’d like to have post-treatment.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: What is “baby” Botox?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Baby Botox is a marketing term that describes using small doses of Botox to prevent the formation of wrinkles. Keep in mind, you still need the correct dosing for your unique anatomy and there isn’t a set unit amount for “baby Botox”. Most patients seeking “baby Botox” want the mild restriction to prevent harsh lines from forming. This is doable but keep in mind that in order for Botox to be “preventative”, the movement must be restricted.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Does Botox prevent wrinkles?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Yes, if started early enough. Botox and other neurotoxins can delay the onset of wrinkles associated with muscle movements from forming. Wrinkles associated with sleeping (your face squishing against the pillow) and wrinkles associated with skin collagen loss are not prevented by treatments with Botox and other neurotoxins.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Why do I still have wrinkles after Botox?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Some patients require a touch-up at their 2-week appointment to perfect their results. Keep in mind, it’s always better to undertreat you initially, especially if it’s your first time receiving facial Botox. We can always add more at your 2-week follow-up appointment, but overtreatment cannot be corrected - you will have to wait for the effects of the neurotoxin to wear off. Additionally, wrinkles from lifestyle (sun exposure, face squishing on a pillow, etc) and collagen loss are not improved with neurotoxin injections.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

@graph.name: Botox Facial Injections
@graph.description: Professional facial neuromodulator injections administered to soften dynamic facial lines—such as frown lines, forehead lines, and crow's feet—and to address masseter hypertrophy or TMJ-related teeth grinding when indicated.
@graph.howPerformed: Neuromodulators are injected into specific facial muscles by a licensed provider using sterile technique in an outpatient med-spa or clinical setting.
@graph.preparation: Follow provider instructions; commonly patients are advised to avoid alcohol and certain blood-thinning medications as directed before treatment.
@graph.followup: A follow-up visit is typically scheduled about 1–2 weeks after treatment for assessment and any needed adjustments; avoid strenuous activity and rubbing the treated area for 24–48 hours.

faqRef.question: How many treatments of laser scar resurfacing do I need?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This varies from person to person. Factors include the degree of scarring and the intensity level of the treatment. During your laser treatment recommendations for treatment courses of action will be provided. The treatment plan can change based on how the scar responds to laser scar therapy treatments each time. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: What is the recovery from laser scar revision?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Patients should expect about 2-4 weeks to start seeing an improvement in the traumatic or surgical scar. This will continue to improve over time after laser therapy for scar tissues. Most laser scar treatments are every 8-10 weeks, depending on the presentation and treatment depth. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"\n\n","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: What is laser scar resurfacing post-care?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Patients will have to avoid having the scar exposed to the sun completely for 2 weeks. Then the patient will want to be sure they’re using at least SPF 50+ when the scar is exposed to the sun there after laser scar-reducing treatments. Proper post-care skincare instructions will be provided at your appointment. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: What devices are utilized for the laser scar revision?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Here at Lushful Aesthetics we only utilize the gold standard lasers, which are the Alma Hybrid and the Alma Veil. The Alma Hybrid utilizes two wavelengths, the 1570 nm wavelength that stimulates and remodels both collagen and elastin fibers without any damage to the top layer of skin, and a CO2 laser to resurface the scar. The Alma Veil is the newest technology in vascular laser treatments and improves the redness found in new scars with its unique 532 nm wavelength. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Do you have before and afters of laser scar resurfacing for surgical or traumatic scars?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We post all of our Before + Afters on our Instagram page. Follow @Lushfulaesthetics to keep up with all of our work. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Can laser scar resurfacing for surgical scars be done in the Summer?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This depends on the commitment of the patient to avoiding sun exposure, so yes. As long as patients can keep the treated area out of the sun and apply SPF 50+ daily for the duration of time discussed with them then they can receive a laser scar rejuvenation treatment along with the proper recovery time for laser scar resurfacing. But if avoiding the sun is going to be a challenge with the patient's Summer lifestyle, then it’s best that they wait for the cooler months. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Can laser resurfacing be done on darker skin tones?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Laser scar resurfacing can be done on patients up to the Fitzpatrick scale of 5. For patients with deeper skin tones it’s best to do Microneedling + Exosomes and Chemical Peels for scar treatments to avoid potential burns. Our expert staff will help you choose which men's med spa services are best for you. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: What is the recovery process for penis girth enhancement?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After receiving Chris Bustamante’s streamlined treatment, patients should expect a few days of mild tenderness. faqRef.question: What are the potential side effects of penis filler injections?

faqRef.question: What results can someone expect from the non-surgical girth enhancement procedure?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Penis filler injections provide immediate results. At 3 weeks the results are considered to be 90% healed and at about 6 weeks your results are 100% healed. Once the results have settled patients can enjoy their new enhanced size or decide that they may want to add more filler to become larger and undergo another round of penis girth enhancement. Patients can expect to increase their girth anywhere from a quarter of an inch to 2 inches, it varies depending on the amount of filler they decide to have injected. faqRef.question: What does penis filler feel like?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We primarily use a thick, durable HA-based filler that feels natural and authentic while blending smoothly beneath the skin. While patients can achieve increased girth by layering filler across multiple sessions, it’s important to maintain realistic expectations. As size increases, the filler may become more noticeable to the touch. This isn’t necessarily a drawback—many patients find that it feels good—but it’s essential to understand that penis filler involves placing a physical substance under the tissue. If you’re actively “feeling for it,” you may be able to detect it.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

faqRef.question: Do you perform penis filler with permanent filler such as BellaFill?

faqRef.question: Who is the ideal candidate for penis girth enhancer?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The ideal candidate for penis enlargement is someone who wants to increase their self-confidence by increasing the erect and flaccid girth of their penis. While flaccid length is increased, erect length is not. Penis filler is not recommended for those with certain chronic medical conditions, excessive pubic fat, or those who do not have realistic expectations of the procedure. faqRef.question: What is the recovery process for penis girth enhancement?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After receiving Chris Bustamante’s streamlined treatment, patients should expect a few days of mild tenderness. faqRef.question: What results can someone expect from the non-surgical girth enhancement procedure?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Penis filler injections provide immediate results. faqRef.question: What does penis filler feel like?

answer.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We primarily use a thick, durable HA-based filler that feels natural and authentic while blending smoothly beneath the skin. ourApproach.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A body or buttocks chemical peel is a procedure that utilizes a solution of active ingredients (mainly acids) to induce a controlled injury to the outermost layers of the skin. Common areas for people to get chemical peels on their body include the back and butt. These areas are prone to acne related to hormones, hair growth, and sweat. Body chemical peels from an aesthetic clinic work beautifully to improve acne/blemishes by increasing the turnover rate of skin cells. Depending on the concern (such as treating sunspots, acne, hyperpigmentation, or acne scars) and the area being treated, multiple body chemical peel sessions may be required for optimal results. Do not wear makeup to your body chemical peel appointment. ​","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
